issue.title: www.lezhinus.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [NSFW] [https://www.lezhinus.com/en/library?page=0](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.lezhinus.com%2Fen%2Flibrary%3Fpage%3D0) ### Comment Username: @PeanutAria > Specifically the problem is with "Adguard Other Annoyances filter" line 8404 (according to VS Code): > lezhinus.com,lezhin.com#$#body * { pointer-events: auto!important; } > > On main "Adguard Annoyances filter", it's line 43863 (according to VS Code): > lezhinus.com,lezhin.com#$#body * { pointer-events: auto!important; } > > When the filter is enable, I can no longer click on the available webtoons that are on My Library. As you can see on the image where Adguard is enabled, when I hover to one of the webtoon, Chasing Lilies, there's no link detected, but when Adguard is disabled, I can click on the webtoons. ### [NSFW] Screenshots

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).
